intro: Diasperus seemannii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and spiny stems. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that are adapted to survive in dry conditions. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to drought-prone environments. Diasperus seemannii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small animals in its native range.
